derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 19th cent.: French, from claquer 'to clap'. The practice of paying members of an audience for their support originated at the Paris opera

means.word_mean: 1. a group of followers hired to applaud at a performance

auth_sentence.content: In Britain, they make an almost novelistically engineered claque of arrivistes.
